channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Tony Stark
item.description:
One thing I find especially sickening is the military exclusion. What SCOTUS Republicans are saying is it’s ok for Black and Brown kids to go to military academies and risk and lose their lives, but otherwise “make your own way.”As a reminder, SCOTUS obviously isn’t elected. But we do elect who appoints them. And confirms them. Affirmative action: The high cost of the Supreme Court’s decision, explained-
https://www.vox.com/scotus/23616868/supreme-court-affirmative-action-harvard-unc-students-fair-admissions-john-roberts

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: The connectome of the adult female fly brain, Drosophila melanogaster:“Neuronal wiring diagram of an adult brain” by Dorkenwald et al. 2023 https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.06.27.546656v1A project that started with Davi Bock and Wei Lee developing the TEMCA for the mouse visual cortex in Clay Reid’s lab (Bock et al. 2011 https://www.nature.com/articles/nature09802), then Bock moving to #HHMIJanelia and developing the instrument much further to deliver the #FAFB volume (Zheng et al. 2018 https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0092867418307876 ), and then the Seung, Murthy and Jefferis labs automatically re-registering, segmenting and annotating the whole volume via #FlyWire and more.Extraordinary!#Drosophila #connectomics #neuroscience #brain

item.title: Kevin Mitchell
item.description:
Degrees of Freedom https://npr.org/2023/06/29/1185005974/degrees-of-freedom - I really enjoyed this interview about agency and free will on @WHYYThePulse
- yes, we really are Player One!

item.title: Ethan White
item.description: "How to make your scientific data accessible, discoverable and useful". Great piece by @jperkel on sharing scientific data (and associated code) featuring tons of great voices including @bleds22e @drkariljordan @inundata. https://doi.org/10.1038/d41586-023-01929-7

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description: 'Open science, says Ellen Bledsoe @bleds22e , “is not an all-or-nothing game”; anything you can do adds value. “Even if you don’t know how to go all the way to zero-to-60 open science, zero-to-20 is also really good,” she says. So, release your data — that gives data consumers more to analyse, and data providers more opportunities for collaboration.'#openscience #neuroscienceUseful tips for data sharing by @jperkel : https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-023-01929-7

item.title: Chris Rodgers
item.description: @computingnature @jperkel @bleds22e Totally agree! I’m a big advocate for sharing. But I think being too maximalist and mandatory about it makes people feel like it’s an imposition or that they’re not qualified. Any amount is better than nothing

item.title: Total Internal Reflection
item.description: New posting! This one is about the number of unpaid hours in #academia, an insight that's come from the realisation of how much time I'm still committing despite now (currently) being unemployed. To what extent is academic research sustained by the massive expenditure of unpaid labour? How much unpaid overtime do you think you're clocking? Let's lift the lid...https://totalinternalreflectionblog.com/2023/06/29/pro-bono-a-riff-on-unpaid-labour-in-academia/

item.title: Guy Rohkin
item.description: Wanted to throw out an intro here~I'm Guy, one of the founders of https://www.scifind.net/, an expert network where scientists go to troubleshoot experimental problems. It's an #openaccess tacit knowledge database (a "lab-rary" 😅) of tips, negative results, optimizations, discussions, methods (stuff that's not in publication really helps get your experiments to work!) Show some love ❤️, take a look, make a post and help out :D #openscience #introduction #ScienceMastodon #biology #synbio #science

item.title: Qasim Rashid, Esq.
item.description: Affirmative action was never about admitting unqualified Black kids. It was always about ensuring qualified Black kids could also get accepted despite a world of systemic racism.The “unqualified admission” you’re thinking of are legacy students—like how Kavanaugh got into Yale, or how George W. got into yale, or how Kushner got into Harvard.Every GOP accusation is a confession, and this is no exception.

item.title: CMDR Yojimbosan UTC+(12|13)
item.description:
From https://isc.sans.edu/diary/Geolocating+IPs+is+harder+than+you+think/29834
...
This is one reason why Google recently started using "google.com/maps" for its "Google Maps." Users will gladly give Google Maps access to their location. After all, the map needs to know where you are to give directions. But by using "google.com/maps" instead of "maps.google.com," all "google.com" properties now have access to the user's location after the user gave access to the location on google.com/maps.

item.title: D A Green
item.description: SUBSTACKWhy the United Kingdom government cannot leave the ECHR without either breaching or re-negotiating the Good Friday AgreementThe overlooked obstacle to the United Kingdom withdrawing from the ECHRhttps://emptycity.substack.com/p/why-the-united-kingdom-government

item.title: JB Emmons
item.description: Yesterday, Donald #Trump posted screenshots on his #TruthSocial account that featured the DC home address for Barack #Obama.In response, a #Jan6 participant boosted Trump's post, added "See you in hell, Podesta's and Obama's!" to his own Telegram, and then drove right over to the Obamas' home.He was arrested nearby, with 2 firearms, 400 rounds, and a machete found in his van.#USpolhttps://www.nbcnews.com/politics/justice-department/jan-6-defendant-arrested-obamas-home-guns-400-rounds-ammunition-van-rcna92094

item.title: Renee DiResta
item.description: “My follower count is dropping! I’m being censored!” Lol no your mid content just resulted in unfollows bc people don’t want to accidentally consume you as part of their 600 posts.

item.title: Eugen Rochko
item.description: I would prefer it if Elon Musk was destroying his site during the work week. This isn't the first time.
